intro: Cotoneaster orientalis, commonly known as the oriental cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It features small, oval leaves that turn red in the autumn, adding ornamental value to the landscape. The plant produces clusters of white flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that persist into winter. It is often cultivated for its compact size and seasonal color changes. Cotoneaster orientalis is relatively low maintenance and adaptable to a variety of soil types.
